name: Sofitel Paris La Defense

reviews.text: Sofitel La Defense is a luxurious respite in the middle of this dreary business park. I have been staying there for five years and have enjoyed each and every one of my stays. The hotel itself is easily accessible by taxi with a basement entrance and elevator. The reception area is warmly lit, welcoming and well-staffed with highly competent professionals who know how to service a very demanding clientele. As in any proper Paris hotel, there is a nice restaurant with good food à la carte or otherwise at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Room service is always delicious and prompt and the rooms themselves very nice with full minibar and all of the amenities. If you stay in a junior suite or a full suite, the feel is truly luxurious.
reviews.title: My favourite place to stay in La Defense

reviews.text: There is a spacious and well-appointed common area on the main floor which is ideal for impromptu business meetings or discussions. And when it's time to go to CDG or Gare du Nord, it's actually quite straightforward with easy access to taxis and trains.
reviews.title: Outstanding-THE place to stay at La Defense

reviews.text: This is a great hotel; up to - maybe even better than - the Sofitel standard in other cities. It's actually made me like La Defense just a little bit more!
reviews.title: Recommend for Service and the Breakfast

reviews.text: This is a business hotel, run efficiently by well trained, intelligent staff who know about business.Rooms are lovely and very comfy (especially the signature bedding), breakfasts are lovely buffet style, meals are very high quality.None of this is cheap but compared to the hideous Novotel, run by the inept, around the corner there is no comparison at all.
reviews.title: Great, but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a good deal - not an amazing deal - and stayed here for a night. I am glad I stayed here, and got great service but would not rush to come back if I had to pay more. Frankly, the appearance of the lobby did not scream "luxury" to me. BUT, the bathroom in the room was quite large and luxurious... with a tub and shower, bath robes, slippers, and Hermes washes... (Another guest said he only had a shower when I praised the tub...?) The breakfast was incredible and where the value is. I did not think the La Defense Esplanade area was convenient or interesting, ( VERY windy with lots of beggars and some weirdo walking with a cell phone having a loud pretend conversation) so please figure that into your estimation of the worth of my appreciation of this hotel's location. It's about E25 to take a cab into Paris if you need to from here.
reviews.title: Fifth visit to this hotel-Getting a good deal.

reviews.text: Our family stayed at Sofitel La Defense for 10 days for the Christmas / New Years Holidays and we could not have had a better stay. Even before we arrived the Concierge was fantastic helping us get museum tickets so that we would not have to wait on the huge lines. When we arrived the front desk was extremely courteous and fast, we had a complex reservation to sort through and they had already done the work. This was indicative our entire stay, extremely nice and helpful staff. The rooms were quite large by Paris standards, well maintained and very quiet because there are no cars on the street level - you are on an esplanade, so it is very quiet. There is a small mall and restaurants directly under the hotel and many on the esplanade. Getting to the #1 Line is a few hundred yards, extremely convenient to get into the center of Paris very quickly and efficiently. I don't quite understand the criticisms of the breakfast buffet - it was extremely generous and high quality. Yes it is expensive but not out of line for what you would spend for a similar buffet at a similar class hotel elsewhere in Paris. This Hotel is not 5 star because the building simply is not capable of offering those type of amenities, the fitness area for example is adequate but not 5 star, but the service and other aspects are really excellent - over 10 days with 3 rooms you can really tell if there are problems. This is an excellent hotel. Do not hesitate!
reviews.title: Excellent stay in a quiet part of town

reviews.text: The hotel was great. The location is close to Metro station (line 1). The room was clean and bed was comfortable. The breakfast was especially good. The quality of the food was exceptional. One problem was that we couldn't get enough towels replaced. Although we placed all the used towel on floor. Only 1 out of 2 towels replaced.
reviews.title: Nice stay during new year holidays
Good hotel outside Paris...
reviews.text: Its a good hotel, nice room, nice breakfast, nice bedroom, nice bathroom, everything nice..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite far to go to Metro station or taxi stand by feet so not recomment for old and big fat people. They hav a drop off for taxi in the basement car park.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, let down by a couple of 'niggles'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the view quite nice. U can see Arc de triumph from there but dont go there by walk :) takes 2 hours trust me!
reviews.title: Treated like film-stars!

reviews.text: Hotel is very stylish and stay was faultless. Food is excellent, drinks a little expensive however. Perfect location for La defense. rooms spotless and beds very comfortable. Would certainly stay again but normally out of price range!
reviews.title: sofitel La Defense

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from 25-28 December and the hotel exceeded all expectations. This is a hotel that lives up to its 5* billing. It is located a couple of minutes from the metro if you need to use it and it has valet parking for 25 Euros.
reviews.title: A great hotel - amazing location and highly recommended

reviews.text: The superior rooms on the 4th floor which we stayed in are tastefully decorated, although I noticed that the rooms on the 7th floor do look a little dated.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are extremely helpful especially the cleaners who are meticulous in the jobs. I would certainly recommend this hotel to both business travellers and to groups of friends who wish to visit the hotel as I cannot find fault with anything in the hotel.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also have hundreds of apples at reception and in the gym which are free for guests and this adds another nice an healthy touch :-)
reviews.title: brilliant hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sofitel for two nights in January 2013. Got a nice deal through Top Secret Hotels on Lastminute.com. The hotel claims to be five-star, but does not quite reach the standard that is expected from a five-star property.
reviews.title: Very good, but not quite five star

reviews.text: We stayed at a standard room. It was spacious and clean, with an otherworldly comfortable bed. The Bose sound system with Ipod docking was also a nice touch.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but very expensive

reviews.text: But to get a truly five-star experience there were small things that were lacking/missing:
reviews.title: A great hotel to visit Paris

reviews.text: - No Nespresso etc machine, but a water boiler with instant coffee.
reviews.title: Manifique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Strange scratch marks in the toilet bowl.
reviews.title: Chic hotel - but lacking certain services that one would associate with every 5 star hotel.

description: Experience Paris as never before through a marvelous mix of modern art, vibrant business, and exciting tourism. Nestled among soaring skyscrapers, Sofitel Paris La Defense offers inimitable French style and five-star luxury with a distinctly 21st century slant. Modern design, luscious shades of browns and reds, and an inviting atmosphere mean a refined Parisian adventure infused with the contemporary energy of la Defense.
